treatment_regimens.description: A list of all treatment regimens mentioned in the study. Include every treatment or combination (e.g., monotherapy, combination therapy) exactly as referenced in the document.

countries.description: A list of all countries where the study was conducted. This should capture every geographical location related to patient enrollment or research sites mentioned in the document.

populations.description: A list of population groups with their specific clinical characteristics. Each entry should comprehensively capture details for a subgroup of patients.

stage_histology.description: Combined disease stage and histology information, including details like the progression stage (e.g., Stage III/IV) and histological classification (e.g., NSCLC, NSCC) as provided in the document.

pdl1_status.description: The PD-L1 expression status, reported either as a percentage or threshold (e.g., 'â‰¥50%'). Capture the value exactly as presented in the study.

n.description: The size of the population group (number of patients or subjects). Ensure the numeric value is extracted accurately.

results.description: An object capturing the treatment outcomes and statistical comparisons from the study. This should include both general and treatment-specific outcome measures.

median_os.description: The median overall survival, usually expressed in months (e.g., '15.2 months' or 'not reached'). Ensure to capture the value exactly as reported.

median_rw_pfs.description: The median real-world progression-free survival if available. This reflects the duration where patients did not experience progression under real-world conditions.

median_pfs.description: The median progression-free survival, used if real-world data is not provided. Capture the value (numeric or text such as 'not reached') as it appears in the document.

os_12_month.description: The 12-month overall survival rate, typically presented as a percentage. Include any associated symbols or qualifiers exactly as mentioned.

treatment_specific_results.description: An object containing results specific to each treatment regimen. Each key should correspond to a treatment regimen, with its value being another object that captures the detailed outcomes for that regimen.

group_difference.description: Any statistical comparisons (e.g., p-values) that indicate differences between treatment groups. Capture the information exactly as provided in the study.
